About PCEA Membley School

Our story combines faith, community trust, and a strong commitment to high-quality, future-ready education.

Mission, Vision, and Values

Our ethos is visible in every lesson, policy, and relationship with learners and parents.

Mission

To evangelize through impactful education and practical skills grounded in Christian values.

Vision

To raise competent and compassionate learners who become principled leaders in society.

Core Values

Integrity, excellence, discipline, respect, servant leadership, and stewardship.

Our History Timeline

2019 - Foundation Phase

The school was established to provide values-based education for families in Membley and Ruiru.

2021 - CBC Growth

Expanded learner pathways and teacher development to strengthen CBC delivery.

2023 - Infrastructure Upgrade

Classrooms, activity spaces, and student support systems were modernized.

2025 - Community Partnership

Parent, church, and school programs were expanded to improve holistic child development.

Culture of Care and Accountability

We combine high academic standards with pastoral support, family partnership, and clear safeguarding systems.

Faculty and Staff

Our leadership and faculty team bring educational expertise, mentorship capacity, and strong learner advocacy.

Principal

Mrs. L. Wanjiku

Oversees school strategy, quality assurance, and parent partnership frameworks. Passionate about leadership that balances excellence and empathy.

Deputy Principal

Mr. K. Maina

Leads curriculum implementation, data-informed teaching improvement, and instructional coaching for class teachers.

Head of Student Welfare

Ms. J. Njeri

Coordinates learner safeguarding, counseling referrals, and interventions that support wellbeing and attendance.

School Chaplain

Rev. S. Muriuki

Supports faith formation, values mentorship, and pastoral care programs for learners and families.

Governance and Leadership Accountability

PCEA Membley School operates under a structured governance board and school leadership team. Governance focuses on policy oversight, financial stewardship, child safety, and continuous quality improvement.

  • Quarterly governance reviews for academic and operational performance.
  • Transparent communication with parents through meetings and term reports.
  • Continuous compliance with safeguarding, health, and educational standards.

PCEA Membley School

Christ-centered, competency-based, and learner-focused education in Membley, Ruiru.
